name: Pseudocode Ide
short_description:
Through the years, we have seen emerge  SDKs and compilers for a lot of platforms: Nintendo, iOS, Android, etc. These SDKs are popular and well documented, and a lot of libraries exists to design user interfaces. But none of these SDKs comes with an IDE. Furthermore, new versions of the targeted platforms and firmware are created on a 1 or 2 years basis.

So, new technologies are integrated in these platforms, then in the hosted applications. But 95% of the applications structure remain the same. This common structure can be described in a kind of pseudo-code terms (i.e. in an xml file).

The idea is not to create a huge super-compatible UML IDE, but a simple and friendly adaptative IDE to help coders develop then compile lite games and apps when they are targetting different platforms like iPhone, Wii or Android.
